channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2023110783
item.description:
Report X-2023110783

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS OUT FOR DELIVERY WHEN IT WAS NOTICED IT WAS LEAKING. PACKAGE BROUGHT BACK TO FEDEX GROUND FACILITY. PACKAGE PUT IN HAZMAT CAGE FOR HANDLING. DescribePack: 1 CONTAINER IN THE PACKAGE HAD A LOOSE CAP AND LEAKED APPROX 3 CUPS DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS TAKEN BACK TO THE FEDEX GROUND FACILITY, IT WAS PUT IN THE HAZMAT CAGE FOR PROCESSING, PACKAGE WAS SECURED, REPACKED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH.

item.title: Report E-2023110496
item.description:
Report E-2023110496

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: PARSIPPANY TROY HILLS
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 13, 2023, two (2) 275-gallon totes of UN3109 were defective and released approximately seventy-five (75) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE began to unload and remediate the impacted cargo. Crews transferred approximately 200 gallons of organic peroxide from the damaged tote into a new tote. Crews cut up the empty tote and added it to a 55-gallon drum for disposal. FCE replaced the cap on the tote missing its cap. All impacted pallets, cardboard, and debris were collected for disposal

item.title: Report X-2023110140
item.description:
Report X-2023110140

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM THE SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO THE EXTERNAL CARTON BEIN PUNCTURED AND SPILLAGE. DescribePack: The package was discovered in the damaged hazmat area after completing processing hazmat. The package was removed from the system flow, due to leakage. Upon inspection of the METAL CAN OF THERMO FISHER SCIENTIFIC TOLUENE 20 LITERS, a small puncture hole that triggered a slow leakage of contents DUE TO MISHANDLING AT THE TERMINAL. There was about 10 ounces of leakage. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2023110117
item.description:
Report X-2023110117

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION THE BOX CONTAINING NITRIC ACID WAS FOUND COMPLETELY WET AND THE BOTTLE HAD A SMALL CRACK CAUSING IT TO LEAK. THE BOX WAS HURRIEDLY PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE DISPOSED OF UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE PACKAGE WAS DUE TO THE BOTTLED BEING CRACKED CAUSING THE PACKAGE OF NITRIC ACID TO BE DAMAGED. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALAVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report E-2023110111
item.description:
Report E-2023110111

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: MERCERVILLE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to unknown reasons, approximately 1 cup of ZEP Brake Flush (UN1993) was released. It was stated that the released product was contained to the outside container and did not impact the dock floor. The SDS was reviewed with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE. The released product and damaged drum was placed into an 85 gallon poly drum and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110110
item.description:
Report E-2023110110

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: CAMDEN
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CONSOLIDATED RAIL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 11, 2023 at 11:45 during a joint Mechanical inspection with FRA at the Conrail Pavonia Terminal PROX 280095 a residue tank car of acetone dripping from the bottom outlet valve of the tank car. Upon inspection it was found that the bottom outlet valve was partially open and the closure pin was not in place. The valve was closed and the pin was replaced in the retainer thus stopping the leak. Marion Environmental, an approved Conrail Contractor was notified to respond, inspect and secure the tank car. Marion personnel, removed the bottom outlet cap and drained the product below the valve. They also found both the liquid and vapor valve secondary plugs less than tool tight. Once the tank car was secured it was released to transportation. FRA Hazardous Material Inspector, Joe Bowen made notifications to both the Shipper and Consignee of the incident. Cause Code: 2 x ( 4 + 3 + 0 ) x ( 2+ 0 ) = 28

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported the spill consists of (1) 1 gallon plastic jug of NC 2116 (Ready To Use -50% Dilution) which was punctured by a forklift blade during dock ops, causing approximately 10 ounces to release inside of the cardboard container. The terminal stated they placed the contents into a 30 gallon poly drum for disposal, the waste was left onsite at the terminal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=773775302415 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1203 CLASS=30 QTY UOM=Liquid - Liter PSN TEXT=GASOLINE PKG GRP=III SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=1 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Liter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=B - Glass# porcelain# or stoneware NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=3 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=1 - Bottle TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=1 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter )The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. Inner contents: All packed in one- 4 glass bottles, packed with Styrofoam peanuts. One bottle was broken. The package was placed in a salvage drum and held for recipient pick up.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: EcoLab Tri-Star Sour VII 5 Gal pail punctured while in transit. Package was immediately placed in RED Tote upon discovery and brought to HAZMAT Cage for further processing. DescribePack: EcoLab Tri-Star Sour VII 5 Gal pail punctured while in transit. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed in RED Tote upon discovery and brought to HAZMAT Cage for further processing.
